curam.util.rules
Class Interrule

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.rules.Interrule

public final class Interrule
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains all the methods required to invoke execution or business rules. This is the only way applications should interact with the business Rules Engine.

Method Summary

Method Detail

executeRulesNoValues

public static RulesResult executeRulesNoValues(java.lang.String ruleSetIdentifier,
                                               long claimReferenceNumber,
                                               long assessmentReferenceNumber,
                                               long personReferenceNumber,
                                               Date dateOfCalculation,
                                               FrequencyPattern inDeliveryFrequency,
                                               EvidenceList textOfEvidenceToBeUsed,
                                               RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode rulesEngineMode,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.Object> preinitializedRDOs)
                                        throws AppException,
                                               InformationalException
This method executes the rule set specified by ruleSetIdentifier. This method is identical to the corresponding executeDynamicRule method in its purpose with only slight difference - it does not calculate values for the objectives and therefore this method is more efficient.

Parameters:
ruleSetIdentifier - is a rule set ID
claimReferenceNumber - is a case ID
assessmentReferenceNumber - is an assessment ID
personReferenceNumber - is a person ID
dateOfCalculation - a date for which eligibility is to be checked
inDeliveryFrequency - is a product or assessment delivery frequency, objectives will contain the rate values for the period specified by this parameter
textOfEvidenceToBeUsed - is the text of a particular evidence to be used by the Rules Engine
rulesEngineMode - is a rules execution mode
preinitializedRDOs - list of preinitialized RDOs, this list must contain only entries of type ItemGroup. Null will be treated as an empty list.
Returns:
RulesResult object that consolidates the result of a particular rules execution. It contains such information as decision, execution result text, text of evidence used, list of achieved objectives and list of achieved objective tags.
Throws:
AppException - ID_RULESTREE_CLASS_ACCESS - if rules tree cannot be instantiated
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_RULESET - if rule set could not be found
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
Interrule.executeDynamicRules(String, long, long, long, Date, FrequencyPattern, EvidenceList, RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode, List)

getDynamicEvidence

public static java.lang.String getDynamicEvidence(java.lang.String ruleSetIdentifier,
                                                  long claimReferenceNumber,
                                                  long personReferenceNumber,
                                                  Date dateOfCalculation,
                                                  boolean retrieveDataFromDB)
                                           throws AppException,
                                                  InformationalException
This method should be used to get the evidence from the standard data source that would be used to evaluate the entitlement of the client. Data retrieved from this method could be modified and used in the executeDynamicRules method.

Parameters:
ruleSetIdentifier - is a rule set ID
claimReferenceNumber - is a case ID
personReferenceNumber - is a person ID
dateOfCalculation - is a date of calculation
retrieveDataFromDB - specifies if data should be retrieved from the database
Returns:
String containing the evidence available for the rule set
Throws:
AppException - ID_RULESTREE_CLASS_ACCESS - if rules tree cannot be instantiated
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_RULESET - if rule set could not be found
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

getDynamicRate

public static java.lang.String getDynamicRate(java.lang.String ruleSetIdentifier,
                                              long claimReferenceNumber,
                                              long personReferenceNumber,
                                              java.lang.String objectiveID,
                                              java.lang.String objectiveName,
                                              Date fromDate,
                                              Date toDate,
                                              EvidenceList textOfEvidenceToBeUsed,
                                              java.util.List preinitializedRDOs)
                                       throws AppException,
                                              InformationalException
This method should be used to calculate the rate value of a given Objective for a given date range. This is intended to be used to calculate the rate value of the Objective for periods other than the delivery period of the case.

The objectiveName parameter of this method should include the list RDO description value(s) in square brackets, if the given objective is located under a list group. The description values can be found in the second column of each line of the given tag values when they are tokenized with the tab value as delimiter. If the given Objective is located under the nested list groups, it may have multiple description values separated with commas. Example of the objective name format is "Employee Objective [John]" where "Employee Objective" is the name of the objective and "John" is the description value. Since the name of the objective is optional, the description value surrounded by square brackets is also valid, example:[John]. If the Objective is not located under a list group then an empty open and close brackets should be passed as objectiveName, example:[]. If an empty open and close brackets are passed in as the objectiveName for the Objective which is located under a list group then the first tag value (tag value of the first iteration of the list group) will be used by the Rules engine for computing the rate.

Parameters:
ruleSetIdentifier - is a rule set ID
claimReferenceNumber - is a case ID
personReferenceNumber - is a person ID
objectiveID - is an ID of an Objective that has to be calculated
objectiveName - is the name of Objective
fromDate - specifies start date for calculation
toDate - specifies end date for calculation
textOfEvidenceToBeUsed - is the text of evidence to be used by the Rules Engine
preinitializedRDOs - list of preinitialized RDOs, this list must contain only entries of type ItemGroup. Null is allowed.
Returns:
the numerical value of the Objective converted to String
Throws:
AppException - ID_RULESTREE_CLASS_ACCESS - if rules tree cannot be instantiated
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_RULESET - if rule set could not be found
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_COMPONENT - if the component cannot be found
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

getDynamicRate

public static java.lang.String getDynamicRate(java.lang.String ruleSetIdentifier,
                                              java.lang.String objectiveID,
                                              java.lang.String objectiveName,
                                              java.lang.String tagValues,
                                              Date fromDate,
                                              Date toDate)
                                       throws AppException,
                                              InformationalException
This method should be used to calculate the rate value of a given Objective for a given date range. The objectiveName parameter of this method should include the list RDO description value(s) in square brackets, if the given objective is located under a list group. The description values can be found in the second column of each line of the given tag values when they are tokenized with the tab value as delimiter. If the given Objective is located under the nested list groups, it may have multiple description values separated with commas. Example of the objective name format is "Employee Objective [John]" where "Employee Objective" is the name of the objective and "John" is the description value. Since the name of the objective is optional, the description value surrounded by square brackets is also valid, example:[John]. If the Objective is not located under a list group, an empty open and close brackets should be passed as objectiveName, example:[].If an empty open and close brackets are passed in as the objectiveName for the Objective which is located under a list group then the first tag value (tag value of the first iteration of the list group) will be used by the Rules engine for computing the rate. * This is intended to be used to calculate the rate value of the Objective for periods other than the delivery period of the case.

Parameters:
ruleSetIdentifier - is a rule set ID
objectiveID - is an ID of an Objective that has to be calculated
objectiveName - is the fully qualified name of Objective.
tagValues - the rate values to be used for calculation
fromDate - specifies start date for calculation
toDate - specifies end date for calculation
Returns:
the numerical value of the Objective converted to String
Throws:
AppException - ID_RULESTREE_CLASS_ACCESS - if rules tree cannot be instantiated
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_RULESET - if rule set could not be found
AppException - ID_UNKNOWN_COMPONENT - if the component cannot be found
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
